dataset.title: Dataset: Sedimentary organic carbon measurements in a restored coastal wetland in San Francisco Bay, CA, USA
dataset.abstract: This project aims to investigate physical sedimentary and organic carbon (OC) characteristics of a recently restored (~11 years) wetland in San Francisco Bay to understand 1) the transition in soil properties immediately following restoration, 2) assess the return to functionality (i.e. has the wetland reached a new equilibrium, or remains in a transition phase), and 3) compare mass accumulation rates and OC burial pre- and post-restoration. This dataset contains results from 3 cores collected in 2018 from different habitat types in the wetland: mudflat (ELM1812-MFA1) cordgrass-dominated (ELM1812-SPA2), and pickleweed-dominated (ELM1812-PWA1). The data include bulk density, total organic matter (%TOM), organic carbon (%OC), nitrogen (%N), and sediment grain size (%Sand, %Silt, and %Clay). Sediment ages were determined from 210Pb data, modeled using the PLUM approach with the modeled ages verified using 137Cs data. All data was measured in 1-cm intervals for the full depth of each core, with core depths ranging from 30-35 cm.
dataset.intellectualRights: This dataset is listed under a Creative Commons BY 4.0 and can be used with attribution. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: Any number of coring types involving driving a tube into the sediment to recover a core

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were included in dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether or not sediment was sieved prior to carbon measurements.

codeDefinition.definition: Sediment was not sieved prior to analysis for organics.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating how the authors qualified or quantified compaction of the core.

codeDefinition.definition: Compaction was at least qualified and noted by the authors

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density. This can include either samples that were freeze dried or oven dried.
Time over which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density.
Sample volume used for bulk density measurements, if held constant.
Any notable codes regarding how the authors quantified dry bulk density.

codeDefinition.definition: Bulk density time recorded herin is an approximate estimate

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Time over which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Code indicating whether fraction carbon was measured or estimated as a function of organic matter.

codeDefinition.definition: Fraction carbon was measured as opposed to modeled

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether or not carbonates were removed prior to calculating fraction organic carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed before measuring organic carbon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The method used to remove carbonates prior to measuring fraction carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were removed using direct application of dilute acid

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method for which fraction carbon was measured or modeled (Note: regression based models are permitted, but the use of the Bemmelen factor [0.58 gOC gOM-1] is discouraged).

codeDefinition.definition: Each sample presented was measured using Elemental Analysis

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction_carbon refers to organic or total carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method used for determining radiocesium activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method used for determining lead 210 activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the mass or accretion rate used in the excess_pb_210_model

codeDefinition.definition: Excess 210Pb modeled using mass accumulation rate

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the model used to estimate accumulation rates and/or age-depth chronologies.

codeDefinition.definition: PLUM dating model used to estimate accumulation rates and/or age-depth chronologies: Aquino-López, M.A., Blaauw, M., Christen, J.A., Sanderson, N.K., 2018. Bayesian Analysis of 210Pb Dating. Journal of Agricultural, Biological and Environmental Statistics 23, 317-333.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the assumption used to estimate the core's supported 226Ra specific activities.

codeDefinition.definition: 226Ra was measured for each sample

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any submitter defined notes elaborating on the process of dating the core not yet made clear by the coding.
Code indicating the reference or 0 year of the age depth model.

codeDefinition.definition: Year zero is set according to Common Era and Before Common Era standards

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Code indicated the method used for determining radium 226 activity

codeDefinition.definition: Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observations or measurement indicating dominant wetland vegetation type.

codeDefinition.definition: Describes wetlands dominated by persistent emergent vascular plants

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how inundation was determined
Core identification code unique to each site.
Year of core collection
Month of core collection
Day of core collection
Positional latitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Positional longitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Code indicating how latitude and longitude were determined.

codeDefinition.definition: Conventional Commercially available hand-held GPS

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how elevation was determined

Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating average annual salinity (Note: Palustrine and freshwater should only include tidal wetlands, or wetlands that are potentially/formerly tidal but artificially freshened due to artificial tidal restrictions).
Indicate whether vegetation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement

codeDefinition.definition: Vegetation inferred by field observation

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how vegetation_class and dominant_species were determined.
Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating how often the coring location is inundated.

codeDefinition.definition: Study-specific definition of an elevation in the relative middle of the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type
Study-specific definition of an elevation in relatively low in the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicated whether or not the coring team believes they recovered a full sediment profile, down to bedrock, or other non-marsh interface.

codeDefinition.code: core depth limited by length of corer
codeDefinition.definition: The total depth of the core was limited by the length of the coring device

attribute.attributeDefinition: Site identification code unique to each study.

Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Dry mass per unit volume of a soil sample. This does not include ash free bulk density.
Mass of organic matter relative to sample dry mass. Ash free bulk density should not be used here but should be expressed as a loss on ignition fraction.
Mass of carbon relative to sample dry mass.
Radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for radiocesium (137Cs).
1 standard error of uncertainty associated with cs137_activity.
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard error of uncertainty associated with total_pb210_activity.
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for Radium 226 (226Ra) if measured as part of the 210Pb dating process.
1 standard error of uncertainty associated with ra226_activity.
Most likely, median, or mean age of the depth interval from submitter generated age depth model.
Site identification code unique to each study.

Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
Mass of nitrogen relative to sample dry mass.
Mass of sand relative to sample dry mass.
Mass of silt relative to sample dry mass.
Mass of clay relative to sample dry mass.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Code indicating any major anthropogenic impacts historically and currently affecting the coring location.

codeDefinition.definition: Tidal flow has been restored by removing an artificial obstruction
Wetland vegetation has been reintroduced by replanting on unvegetated surfaces

Code associated with a species or a vegetation assemblage.

Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's or 'et al.' if more than three, then publication year spearated by underscores. See worksCited.bib for more detail.
